messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: baths
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for all the different takes on the bath. We have done the hair washing on the sink and it has worked quite well...just haven t done it for
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for all the different takes on the bath. We have done the hair washing on the sink and it has worked quite well...just haven't done it for awhile...thanks for the reminder :)

I have never liked baths, I don't even like hot tubs in particular. I surfed as a teenager and always loved the ocean so it isn't that I don't like the water ( I LOVE SHOWERS!) . I don't know?

I have found that bathtime goes smoother when I get in, so it is worth it and works best for all of us.

Thanks for all of your ideas.

Ticia



----- Original Message -----
From: Tami
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, January 11, 2004 11:02 PM
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: baths


LOL, I love baths :)

We even have a hot tub :) Yummy!!
'Namaste' is an East Indian greeting which means 'the light within me
bows to the light within you.' In other words, beyond our achy bones,
our tired feet and our multi-colored real life soap operas, lurks a
dimension that is more than the body, the persona, the ego and all the
'trappings and the suits of woe' as Hamlet would say---a dimension where
there isn't a 'you' and 'me' but rather a synergy that is more than all
that, a space for the eternal to rest within the temporal.



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
